bug.author: ohsewon
bug.summary: [TensorDec] Struct variable name is too long.
bug.description:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnstreamer/TAOS-CI/issues/256>nnstreamer/TAOS-CI#256</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12094135/45661386-47aec980-bb38-11e8-84f2-6928d4c63bd6.png></denchmark-link>
This error comes from long variable name. Gstreamer suggest indent rule(<denchmark-link:https://gstreamer.freedesktop.org/documentation/frequently-asked-questions/developing.html#what-is-the-coding-style-for-gstreamer-code>https://gstreamer.freedesktop.org/documentation/frequently-asked-questions/developing.html#what-is-the-coding-style-for-gstreamer-code</denchmark-link> ) and we should keep rules. In the rule, line-length should be less than 80. but this case struct in struct in struct.. so using variable like self->tensordec_mode_image_label.image_labeling_info.labels . That mean, it is easy to over line-length 80. Thus, we should shorten variable name.

comments.comment: : Thank you for posting issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/issues/542>#542</denchmark-link> . The person in charge will reply soon.
I will update variable name with regarding this
